document.docTitle: Nemapalpus spinosus Bravo & Barata, 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Nemapalpus Macquart (Diptera, Psychodidae, Bruchomyiinae) from caverns in Minas Gerais State in southeastern Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Nemapalpus Macquart (Diptera, Psychodidae, Bruchomyiinae) from caverns in Minas Gerais State in southeastern Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Length of flagellomeres 2 + 3 combined slightly longer than length of flagellomere 1 ; third palpomere swollen apically; wing with R-M basal to medial fork; aedeagus bifurcated with brush-like apices; gonocoxal apodeme fused and posteriorly expanded as a medial plate with four spine-like apical tips; spermatheca with wrinkled appearance.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–7.
Nemapalpus spinosus
sp. nov.
, male. 1. Head. 2. Antenna: scape, pedicel and flagellomeres 1–2. 3. Antennal flagellomeres 1–3. 4. Distal part of flagellomere 6, showing ascoid. 5. Palpus. 6. Palpus, palpomeres 2 and 3. 7. Wing. as = ascoid.

FIGURES 8–15.
Nemapalpus spinosus
sp. nov.
Male terminalia. 8. Dorsal. 9. Apex of gonocoxal apodeme. 10. Ventral. 11. Lateral. 12. Epandrium, cerci and sternite 10. Female terminalia. 13. Ventral. 14. Subgenital plate and cerci. 15. Spermatheca. ae = aedeagus; bes = basal elongate seta of cercus; ega = extension of gonocoxal apodemes; esp = spermatheca; llp = lateral lobe of paramere; msh = median sheath of parameres.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female. Similar to male except as follows: genital furca Y-shaped; genitalia with U-shaped structure articulated to genital furca (
Fig. 13
); cercus digitiform, with a long seta inserted basally (
Figs. 13, 15
; lbr); subgenital plate pentagonal with basal margin inverted-U shaped and with two apical lobes, digitiform, 0.5 times the length of subgenital plate (
Fig. 14
); one spermatheca, longer than the length of subgenital plate, with wrinkled appearance (
Fig. 15
, esp).

Material examined. Holotype : Male, BRAZIL , Minas Gerais, Diamantina, Cavern of Salitre (
18 º 16 ’ 47 ” S
;
43 º 32 ’ 10 ”W
),
18 .V. 2010
, Barata, R.A. col. (MZUEFS). Paratypes : 23 paratype males and 13 paratype females, same locality, date and collector as holotype ; 0 8 paratype males and 0 1 paratype female, same locality and collector as holotype ,
30 .VI. 2011
; Minas Gerais, Diamantina, Cavern Monte Cristo (
18 º 17 ’ 49 ”S
;
43 º 33 ’ 30 ”W
), Barata, R.A. col.: 0 8 paratype males,
30 .VI. 2011
; 0 8 paratype males and 0 5 paratype females
26 .V. 2011
; 0 3 paratype males
30 .V. 2011
; 11 paratype males and 0 1 paratype female,
30 .VI. 2011
. Paratypes are deposited in MZUEFS and MZUSP .

Etymology. Latin,
spinosus
: spiny; refers to apical end of medial plate that corresponds to fused parameres.
Distribution. Currently known only from the two caverns in Brazil .

Remarks.
Nemapalpus spinosus
sp. nov.
can be easily recognized by a set of diagnostic characters (see diagnosis above). The relative position of the R-M crossvein, i.e. basal to medial fork, as observed in the new species is a characteristic shared with most species of Neotropical
Nemapalpus
(See
Alexander 1979
,
Wagner 1999
,
Quate & Alexander 2000
,
Santos et al. 2009
). However,
N. spinosus
exhibits some characters that are unique among species of Nemaplapus , such as a swollen third palpomere, and plate-shaped gonocoxal apodeme with four spine-like apical tips.
